POF day 1 = 38 messages. Bristlr day 14 = 0 messages. I'm an attractive

Really? This app is dead.

Well looks like I was one of the lucky ones. Installed Dec 2015, met a handsome beard that month and we now live together.  Seemed to work well at the time!
completely inactive user base. Every person I have seen so far was 'online: more than a week ago' and there is no way to filter to more active users ... if there are any.

Complete and total rubbish.
Not enough users actively using it.. great concept but.... very quiet

I think something is wrong. The search engine doesn't work properly for sure. And i notice a huge batch of new profiles appear all with a letter and number after them, all from the same country. I don't think it's as popular as it's made out to be.

Great idea in theory but the app is rubbish. You can't filter by gender and the order is the same every time so you end up scrolling through people you've seen already. Maybe the injection of cash from the dragons will help, it definitely needs work as the competition is so much more sophisticated
Unable to load
All I get is an error: Cannot read property 'sizes' of null

Considering my beard is pretty awesome, never had one match. I even liked every person on there, just to see if anyone had liked me. Nothing. If I can't get a date on a beard dating site with a beard like mine, then I may as well give in. Probably got more chance of getting a date from these comments than the actual site

Tried signing on through facebook, but then it asks for my email and says that email is already being used on another account. I've tried reinstalling multiple times and it still won't work. Also nobody in my area. Seriously disappointing. Tried the app again hoping things had improved. NOPE.
replyContent:
If you're getting the "your email is already in use" error, it means you've likely already signed up, and you can get your password reset via bristlr.com. 

We're working on an update to make the app more friendly to this specific issue.

content: Last update was back in March. I stopped using this a year ago then came back to all the same old people in my area. App seems like it's pretty dead. Maybe it was the Tinder for beards in 2014, but it sure isn't now.
Almost all users have not been active for "more than a week" which could practically mean "several months". This place is dead.
Completely dead. Don't bother

I searched for an app like this and thought it would meet my needs. But there's no point in using it trying to meet anyone. I've had messages from one person that turned out to be fake. The matching system is useless, because you both need to match to communicate unless they ticked different. A lot on there haven't been on in over a week.....but that's the maximum time listed - it could be months and still say that.
All fakes A9 after their names or H9 B4 Any cap letter then a number  are fake profiles. The real people I assume just never deleted the account.
I wish it was easier to tell who has a beard and who also wants a beard. I'm pretty sure the app is a big ol beard tease for me.

This is a great concept... that people with beards can meet other people w or w out beards... however I think the app needs to be revamped to feel more like a community where people can connect! This is like a dating site. You can only message people, for example, if you have a match. That doesn't work for 2 guys just wanting to connect n make friends in their area to talk about their beards or bikes. Also it seems like people have profiles but nobody's on.
No one local and not enough users, people who are have quit using it.

Like the patterns are obvious. Just a first name followed by a letter. This is why real people never stay on it.
replyContent:
We don't use bots. Accounts where it's firstname, letter, then number, are people who've signed up with Facebook and that's the auto-generated username.

(Edit: Though I want to add that I appreciate your Gengrich joke.)

content: Will someone explains this app to me...all the same people no one to say hi to. Why do half the photos look like they were made with a combo  porn filter  meets  a proof of life filter.a great idea that failed- like silent velcro.  Keep the beard delete the app.

content: Slowest dating app I've ever been on. I've matched with one person, and I can definitely tell you it's not due to lack-there-of a beard. Just not ready to be widely used I suppose.
Thought this was for straight men and women. Might want to specify that it's a gay sight
replyContent: Only around 4% of our users are gay. The vast majority are straight, and around half our users are women. It might have been that your filters were set up to only show you people with beards?

Great idea, great implementation. Works flawless. I registered, expecting a beard social network, not a beard tinder, but my mistake is not an excuse for a bad grade. You guys were awesome.

First, an option to only see people who are active. Second, if I hide them, actually do it app. And gender selection.

Clicked the sign in with Facebook button. Entered my Facebook details. Clicked yes to you posting things on fb etc. Tried to view the home page but was told to login. Clicked the Facebook bit again and it says "account already in use" well yeah, I'm using it but you won't let me use it!?!? Explain?
replyContent:
That sounds like a bug! (We run a mugs-for-bugs deal, drop me an email and I'll post you a free Bristlr mug). We've had some issues with [stupid annoying thing] on Galaxy phones recently, as well as a few teething issues with Facebook login. We're on it!

In the mean time, you can also log in via your phone's browser by visiting http://bristlr.com.

content: Just a website wrapper. Hides the status bar.
replyContent: For the most part, yeah. Bristlr mostly exists on bristlr.com, and we built this super basic app due to demand from users. We're a tiny team (one developer, me, hello!) and we'll be adding more features to the app as time goes on.

content: Met one awesome woman so far. Still needs more people me thinks but great. I really like how it's not over gendered. Makes it accessible for all gender identies. :)

Hmmm..ladies if you like a man with facial hair this just may be the app for you!! Just opened it & registered, â™¡'d a few fellas l thought were' FINE' & I already  have messages!! Will keep you posted! Guys with beards should join up...can always make new friends at least....!!;)

notifications are a joke, this app is very poor, if it wasn't for all the beards...

Was super excited to download.   Will not let me "choose a photo"  cannot create a account. Samsung Galaxy s5 active.
The loading times when doing anything are pretty long, what server are you hosting the API on? If you need a hand with systems admin I'd happily help out :)
replyContent: Thanks for the offer! Everything is currently on AWS. The long load times are caused by the app's middleware needing to wait for everything to be loaded before it can display anything, so it's slower than it should be. This is just the prototype app, it'll be getting some pretty major updates soon.

content: Won't let me create an account. It won't let me chose a profile picture and you need this to create an account

content: I think it's good so far since it's just starting out. In the future it would be cool to delete some of the old messages from people you don't talk to and be able to see who likes you. But other than that love it
replyContent: Sorting the inbox is a high priority for us. I feel it's a sign of the speed of growth that it's only been in the last few weeks that people have started sending so many messages that we _need_ to get the inbox sorted.

content: This is a new approach to social media specifically for Beadsmen and those who appreciate facial hair. Yes there are growing pains, this is normal while bugs are being ironed out by. John promptly replies to all email support queries. (thanks John). Spread the word and help grow this network of beard enthusiasts!

Good idea, but having to refer 3 different friends every time you want to check who likes you is just not beneficial. It's so easy  generating 3 fake profiles to get activate the button. This means that more than half of the profiles are fake.  Pointless to browse knowing this.
replyContent: The feature you're talking about, where you can see who likes you, is an optional extra. The vast majority of people don't use this. You can always see when you like somebody and they like you back with the little red hearts.

content: Thanks for the App! It's truly a good addition to the website! I know it's a hobby, creating a social media network for bearded men, but you're doing great! If you need a Beta tester, let me know! =)
